SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.io.parser.json

Class JsonFormatter

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.io.parser.json.JsonFormatter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IOWorker<List<Person>>, Formatter<Person>, AutoCloseable
public class JsonFormatter extends Object implements Formatter<Person>
A JSON-based implementation of the Formatter interface for handling collections of Person.

This class uses Gson for serialization and deserialization of Person objects and provides methods to read collections from and write collections to JSON files.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • read

      public List<Person> read()
      Reads a collection of Person objects from the JSON file.

      If the file does not exist, is not readable, or is empty, an empty list is returned.

      Specified by:
      read in interface IOWorker<List<Person>>
      Returns:
      a list of Person objects, or an empty list if the file cannot be read

    • write

      public void write(List<Person> values)
      Writes a collection of Person objects to the JSON file.

      If the file is not writable or does not exist, the operation will be aborted.

      Specified by:
      write in interface IOWorker<List<Person>>
      Parameters:
      values - the collection of Person objects to write

    • ready

      public boolean ready()
      Checks if the file is ready for I/O operations.

      Ensures the file exists, is not a directory, and is both readable and writable.

      Specified by:
      ready in interface IOWorker<List<Person>>
      Returns:
      true if the file is ready, false otherwise

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the formatter.

      This implementation does not require any specific cleanup, so this method is empty.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
